What do u do if u don’t have the money and the only thing the NHS offers in my area is online (before covid) and has an extremely long waiting list?

A huge thank you to Zoey & Alexis for this type of content aknowledging anxiety is a massive step, I've only came to accept that I do have anxiety through zoey actually many years ago, I've been learning & trying to cope with it on my own because it's so rare to find a proper therapist that you can genuinely talk to where I live, nonetheless, those methods you were talking about do actually work in most cases, the rest is all personal effort and I think it's totally fine to mess up sometimes when things get out of hand as long as you get right back at it, it's a work in progress, the initiative that lush and Zoey are working on is absolutely amazing but we're not all fortunate to have access to such wholesome professional therapists & it's okay we can do our researches & learn until we find the method that works best for us.
thank you so much for filming this, I loved it and definitely made me feel less alone🥰
The timing of this video is perfect; it has really helped. Thank you!

LOVE this video so much! i’ve struggles with anxiety since i was 11 years old. you’ve always inspired me to speak about it and be more open about my personal experience. i haven’t been keeping up with a therapist for the past year or so, but this video really inspired me to get back into therapy. this digital detox series has truly inspired me to put more limits on my social media. thank you, zoe and alexis xx
Zoe, this was such good information. Please thank your therapist for the tools. Great job!

It has been helpful to me to understand that my thoughts are thoughts, they are not me. I don't have to believe every thought that comes to mind. Knowing that there is a separation between those two, when a panic attack arises I breathe in and out, and have learnt to see it as an interpretation the mind have of a situation and that is not necessarily real. It quickly fades away
loved this, i've been following you for so many years and you never fail to put out great content x
This was so calming 💞

I really enjoyed this. I recommended it to my 14 year old sister as she is really absorbed in social media and suffers from anxiety. I like how Alexis just reminds us how everyone has worries and anxious feelings but something that bothers you wouldn't even phase them. It's also good to have that anxiety to keep us safe and understsnd ourselves and I wouldn't change my mental health as it makes me a much better and more understanding person. Thanks for sharing 🖤 I also really want to look into speaking to someone more regularly because I often find my mental health peaks and dips at random points so I would like to manage that better on a more long term basis x

I'm a teen growing up in a household where mental health is a myth, something I can take care of by myself so having a therapist has never been an option. I'e educated my self about anxiety because for the past 4 years I've had constant anxiety attacks and been through other situations that I thought where what everyone went to but realized it is not. Seeing you having a conversation like this is the most helpful source I have come across. The metaphor of the lion in the bush was so spot on for me, specially while in lockdown. Where I'm from, lockdown is not done yet but all the videos this week have been really helpful for me. Thank you for speaking so openly about your anxiety and spreading the importance of mental health.💕💞

I went out and bought the bath bomb to show my support to the charity and it looked lovely too (I havent even got a bath) I have a hotel trip booked! The earliest age I remember I must have been around 2/3 years old having a bottle of milk in my mums bed and the car got broken into and I was throwing up because I was anxious and I have been like that really quite bad until I started working! ❤ zoe is amazing for raising awareness and using her platform!!!! As some one with social anxiety, I thought being off work from the end of March till now I thought I would be a lot more scared or worried about going back but when I lost my job a couple of works ago . I just wanted to get back to work but thankfully I have got a new job and will be starting in a week or so.

Things I find that help me anxiety personally:
• watching my favourite YouTube videos (Zoe and mark mostly)
• listening to my one tree hill music playlist
• just sitting and cuddling my dog
• or just letting my self cry (just let your emotions out)

This is also pushing me to talk to a therapist as I’ve been told would help me xx

The bit that is really beneficial for me, a person who has been battling with anxiety for 11 years and has recently decided to break up with my anxiety per se, is the end when your therapist says "it's just like the other thousands of worries, it's not going to happen," reassured me that I don't have to continue listening to my "Tricky Brain" (that is what my therapist and I called my anxiety). It's useless to go on endlessly about things that won't happen, or may or may not happen.

Love this!! But I find a lot of people dont understand anxiety they just say everyone has it. The difference is that it's not just anxiety(normal that everyone has) but the disorders... theres many anxiety disorders that people suffer with. I honestly feel like it's different to normal anxiety that everyone has so I think people shouldnt be belittling others for actually having a disorder they should be more educated on what anxiety disorders are out there and the different reasons to why people may suffer with these disorders. All in all!! Great job in spreading the awareness!! Need to see more of it!!❤❤
